intro: Taraxacum iwabuchii, commonly known as the Iwabuchi dandelion, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and a flowering stem that bears a single flower head. The plant produces a distinctive yellow composite flower that develops into a white, fluffy seed head. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. Taraxacum iwabuchii is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
